primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters a world of monstrous evil (Herod/Sin/Death) through the Incarnation to establish a reign that overthrows human tyranny and rectifies the suffering of the innocent.

tekstueel_bewijs: God the Father did not turn away.
Jesus teaches us that human judgments are not the last judgments.
He comes to make his blessings known far as the curse is found.

object.identificatie: The rectification of suffering and the establishment of a 'Last Word' of love.
tekstueel_bewijs: the agonies of the victims will some day be rectified
the unconditional love of God in Jesus Christ will be the Last Word

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Biblical Narrative
tekstueel_bewijs: The authors of Scripture did not turn away... God the Father did not turn away.

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'small victims', the bereaved (Rachel), and the 'mature, educated citizens' (the hearers).
tekstueel_bewijs: the agonies of the victims will some day be rectified
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as a Receiver of hope/comfort who must witness the Subject's action.

helper.identificatie: The Lament (Rachel), the Church's memory (Father Lucic), and the Cross.
tekstueel_bewijs: by putting Rachel’s lament at the heart of the Christmas story, Matthew has shown us how to hold on to faith
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (the narrative/liturgy) sustaining the hearer.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Monsters (Herod, child abusers, tyrants, the 'Curse').
tekstueel_bewijs: monsters who kill in the night
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a moral failing but a 'homicidal frenzy' and 'monsters' that challenge the very existence of God's reign.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's duty to 'not look away' and to name the monsters.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Faith and tenacity in the face of barbarity.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action of 'holding on' is only possible because the Primary Program (God's entry into suffering) provides the framework.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → Overthrowing the 'Last Word' of Evil

voorbeelden_god_subject: God the Father did not turn away.
He comes to make his blessings known.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must listen to this objection.
We can't run away from the suffering.
We must keep Ivan Karamazov’s protest in our minds.

voorbeelden: We must listen to this objection.
We must keep Ivan Karamazov’s protest in our minds.
I just wanted to be here.
be aware of the deep and far-reaching claims
the power that humans exercise... is not the final power
how to hold on to faith

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Final Power' (Pouvoir) of God which grants the hearer the 'Pouvoir' to endure/believe despite the 'Devoir' of the world's suffering.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Sentimentalism) to S2 (The reality of monsters) to S1 (The Savior reigns through the Cross).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by removing S2, but by God (S1) entering S2 (the Rachel passage/the Cross) to negate its finality.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon refuses to minimize the 'ghastly' reality of evil.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies God as the one who acts in the face of cosmic evil. Human action is relegated to 'witnessing' and 'not looking away,' which is a response to God's prior non-turning.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We can’t run away from the suffering of the world.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of the 'Last Word'
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the unconditional love of God in Jesus Christ will be the Last Word.
monsters who kill in the night... a radical challenge to my faith.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (The Holy Family) are presented as victims/refugees under God's care, not as moral examples to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The Holy Family shows God's participation in human displacement.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'astringent' comfort; the burden of 'fixing' the world is replaced by the hope of God's rectification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is an act of God that encompasses even the 'no more' of death.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the horror of the 'Opponent' with the necessity of the 'Subject' (God).
spanning_punten: The coexistence of angels and monsters.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: human justice is not the last justice... the power that humans exercise... is not the final power.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'tenacity' of faith to the narrative of Christ rather than a specific pneumatological indwelling.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Absolute; sin is 'monstrous' and 'brutal,' not merely a mistake.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's refusal to turn away from a world dominated by 'monsters.'

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on 'Savoir' (knowing the truth of the story).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on God's 'Pouvoir'.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'tenacity' of the Sarajevo worshippers more explicitly to the Spirit's gift of 'Pouvoir'.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already treats the opponent with maximum seriousness.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's reign) remains the foundation for the secondary program of human endurance.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in 'Theocentric' preaching that avoids the trap of sentimentalism by facing the 'Opponent' head-on.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the use of the Berlioz/Sarajevo anecdotes, Greimas reveals that these function as 'Helpers' to establish the Subject's (God's) competence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the 'fulfillment' of Jeremiah; Greimas shows how 'Rachel' functions as a necessary actantial constraint to prevent the story from collapsing into 'Sentimentalism'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Monsters' are the primary Opponents that necessitate a Divine Subject, proving the sermon is structurally incapable of being moralistic.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's own 'Grammar of Grace' perfectly.
